text: the fact that you can constantly critique and oppose American decisions is a fundamental part of its moral superiority
almost none of you have any clue and sometimes it’s amusing to watch and sometimes blackpilling

people would rather recite some patriotic pablum than ask hard questions about what America should actually be doing. is its own constitution important or the whims of the executive? is it “based” to get involved in “foreign wars” or “cringe” to try and run latam protectorates

politics is more important than technologists think but less important than the world in general thinks. bad governance can piss away all the fruits of technological progress, create horrifying tech-powered dystopias, or end scientific progress in entire domains indefinitely

RT @eigenrobot: concept: Super Mario Brothers Super Show Ramayana Holiday Special

Mario as Rama
Bowser as Ravana
Luigi as Hanuman
Peach as…
i always wondered if the parallels were intentional or if it’s just a common archetype and mythos
you’re reciting slop, arguing with strawmen much dumber than me
forget international law, forget Europeans, what about our law! American law matters
